metadata.title: CVE-2020-15095 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: Versions of the npm CLI prior to 6.14.6 are vulnerable to an information exposure vulnerability through log files. The CLI supports URLs like "<protocol>://[<user>[:<password>]@]<hostname>[:<port>][:][/]<path>". The password value is not redacted and is printed to stdout and also to any generated log files.

criterions.comment: npm package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.14.6+ds-1ubuntu1').
